intro: Reichardia laciniata, commonly known as the cutleaf buttercup, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its basal leaves that are deeply lobed or dissected. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, typically appearing in early spring. Reichardia laciniata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is a short-lived perennial that spreads through rhizomes and can form dense colonies.
